channel.title: Hey all, I've got a problem
channel.description:
First off, I know this is my first post..you can call me a leech or whatever. It won't effect me in any way. Now down to the problem.
I am currently trying to create a 317 RSPS. (By the way, sorry I'm not dumb when it comes to copmuters/RSPS...in other words..I'm not a 10 year old trying to create one. ;D)I am using Extreme-X's source and client. However for some reason I am just not able to get on the server. Let me tell you guys everything that I have done, I think I might be missing something..maybe someone could see it. I am able to get on the client but when I try to log in I get the error message.
1. I of course downloaded the source and client, unziped...in the Source Run and compile I added my JDK to it (Most recent) Also in the client build and run I added the correct JDK.
2. I set up the following variable: PATH : C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\
3. I set up no-ip..added the IP from ipchicken.com. Downloaded it, and got my host name all set.
4.Changed the old host 3 times in the client.java to my host. (Is there somewhere else I'm suppose to do this?)
5. I port forwarded..however I am having some crazy problems with this. Sometimes the port is open, sometimes its not. But I would think that I should be able to still get on it with this right? But, I have spent a couple hours on port fowarding and I have no idea whats going on. I even dl'ed a program that does it for me..its worked in the past.
6. random question: Would my IP have to be dynamic or static..or does that not matter?
Well thats everything I can think of. Please suggest everything to me. I am so confused, I once was working with a RSPS and I never had any problems...I don't know why I am now.
Thanks! Take care!

item.title: Hey all, I've got a problem
item.dc:creator: @Edock Edock
item.description:
@Edock wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:14, topic:384707”]How many times do I have to say this…

If the server is running on the local machine, you MUST use localhost/127.0.0.1/etc
If the server is running on the local network, you MUST use 192.168.X.X/etc
If the server is running else where, you MUST use the No-IP/Hamachi/etc. address.[/quote]

Well, thanks for saying it once more. It’s appreciated.

Read full topic
item.source: Hey all, I've got a problem

item.title: Hey all, I've got a problem
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

How many times do I have to say this…

If the server is running on the local machine, you MUST use localhost/127.0.0.1/etc
If the server is running on the local network, you MUST use 192.168.X.X/etc
If the server is running else where, you MUST use the No-IP/Hamachi/etc. address.

Read full topic

item.title: Hey all, I've got a problem
item.dc:creator: @Edock Edock
item.description:
@Edock wrote:

[quote=“Zhawa, post:12, topic:384707”]cough 12 year old cough

If you are so ‘Advanced in computers’ why would you need to ask such simple questions. Idiot[/quote]

hmm, I’m new to making RSPS. I don’t spend all my time focusing on them. And I never said I was advanced in computers, I just said I wans’nt dumb with them.

And why post if you have nothing useful to say?

Read full topic

item.title: Hey all, I've got a problem

item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Just for future reference:

No-ip removes the issues related to having a dynamic ip address.

Read full topic
item.source: Hey all, I've got a problem

item.title: Hey all, I've got a problem
item.dc:creator: @Edock Edock
item.description:
@Edock wrote:

24jared24:

Go into your client files, and look fro Gui.java and open it then change the ip in there to yours.

It appears that I do not have gui.java I checked every area and then re-checked. No luck. Thanks tho

[quote=“Rash, post:7, topic:384707”]Read his post, he states that he has done that.

Do you have a dynamic Ip?[/quote]

Yes! At the time I wrote this I had a dynamic IP. Is it suppose to be dynamic or static…I thought i read somewhere its suppose to be dynamic.

DynastyRSPS:

Make sure your client.java server ip is set to ‘127.0.0.1’, then go into the source files and run the server. Then run the client and login!

YOU SIR! Are a miracle worker, I don’t know why I failed to use the loopback address. This worked, I am now in. But I would not be able to use this with this IP would I?

Read full topic
item.source: Hey all, I've got a problem

item.title: Hey all, I've got a problem
item.dc:creator: @DynastyRSPS DynastyRSPS
item.description:
@DynastyRSPS wrote:

[quote=“Edock, post:1, topic:384707”]First off, I know this is my first post…you can call me a leech or whatever. It won’t effect me in any way. Now down to the problem.

I am currently trying to create a 317 RSPS. (By the way, sorry I’m not dumb when it comes to copmuters/RSPS…in other words…I’m not a 10 year old trying to create one. ;D)I am using Extreme-X’s source and client. However for some reason I am just not able to get on the server. Let me tell you guys everything that I have done, I think I might be missing something…maybe someone could see it. I am able to get on the client but when I try to log in I get the error message.

  1. I of course downloaded the source and client, unziped…in the Source Run and compile I added my JDK to it (Most recent)
    Also in the client build and run I added the correct JDK.

  2. I set up the following variable:
    PATH : C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\

  3. I set up no-ip…added the IP from ipchicken.com.
    Downloaded it, and got my host name all set.

4.Changed the old host 3 times in the client.java to my host. (Is there somewhere else I’m suppose to do this?)

  1. I port forwarded…however I am having some crazy problems with this. Sometimes the port is open, sometimes its not. But I would think that I should be able to still get on it with this right? But, I have spent a couple hours on port fowarding and I have no idea whats going on. I even dl’ed a program that does it for me…its worked in the past.

  2. random question: Would my IP have to be dynamic or static…or does that not matter?

Well thats everything I can think of. Please suggest everything to me. I am so confused, I once was working with a RSPS and I never had any problems…I don’t know why I am now.

Thanks! Take care![/quote]
Make sure your client.java server ip is set to ‘127.0.0.1’, then go into the source files and run the server. Then run the client and login!

Read full topic

item.title: Hey all, I've got a problem
item.dc:creator: @Edock Edock
item.description:
@Edock wrote:

Owner Dutch:

Well, u can’t login with ur No-ip or u can’t even log in with 0.0.0.0?

I can log into my no-ip…what I cant log into is the server. When I type my user and pass in…I get the common error message “can not connect to server” or whatever it is. I can not log into it what so ever.

Read full topic
